visualization_prompt: Generate a mapbubble chart showing population density distribution across countries using logarithmic color scaling and inset adjustments for Pacific islands

visualization_code.CSS:
#container { margin: 0 auto; height: 600px; }
.loading { margin-top: 10em; text-align: center; color: gray; }

visualization_explanation:
The dataset combines geographical polygons with population metrics across 195 countries. TopoJSON topology provides vector map data with ISO country codes, while synthetic population data follows logarithmic distribution (μ=500k, σ=300k) to simulate real-world density patterns. Temporal elements are excluded as this represents a cross-sectional analysis.

The mapbubble visualization employs Tufte's data-ink principles by using subtle basemap coloring (#f5f6fa) and prominent bubble encoding. Cairo's perceptual topology is maintained through Pacific island insets preventing shape distortion. Logarithmic color scaling handles right-skewed population data while bubble sizes provide dual encoding of density values. Coordinate adjustments for China/India centers follow Winkel tripel projection standards.
